column4: Have anyone noticed that the Sun Java JRE doesn't work anymore with Hoary 5.04, it worked for a few days ago, but not anymore.. been reinstalling and jabbing around with it now for a while!
it works fine for me.
what version do you use?
1.4.1 from IBM

even if I tried to figure out how to download the IBM one.. I never find a way, but I learned something, both of the two other java kits for Linux is just copies from Sun anyways.. so why choose them? and why can't the 1.5.0-02 work?
I use IBM's because it's tuned for my applications.

something like that I learned aswell, IBM was talking alot of their java but in conjunction of their products.. but for rest of us there must be a way to get the SUN to work, especially now when it work for a few days ago!!
please explain what sort of issues you have.

I downloaded the sun for a few the week before last, installed the rpm through alien, went fine and fast! made a symb.link to my home/.moz.. you know... my online banking started to work! Lovely, now for a few days ago my bank online stoped to work, I complained of course, but after the nasty email I noticed that the test on Sun's homepage didn't work aswell. .followed the instructions for troubleshooting the problem with Sun and
what do you think about the java issue?
lsmod|grep sd_mod
yes that module is loaded if that is what you mean..
in dmesg, is there any output regarding "sd" ?

yes I get some outputs about it, a nice list though so I don't think I can give it to you here on the channel. It gives me the partitions and some other facts.. it worked for a few weeks ago. Stoped as well as my Java to work at a stage...
paste onto http://pastebin.com
can you give me a hint what that site is all about, please? looks intressting but don't know how to classify things..
paste your sd-related output from dmesg onto there. It's used for troubleshooting.
will someone look at that and might change something in future updates is that the way it works? Thanks anyways...
we use it for large pastes/floods
do you have an idea why SUNs Java engine stoped work as well here just before release of Horay?
it works fine on my Hoary system (both 1.4.2 and 1.5.0)
the 1.5 update2 worked as well fine for me, but when it stoped working I installed the 1.4.2 and when I visit a site with java the browser crashes! annoying it is!
you have to use 1.5 update 3
I downloaded the latest Java from SUN and at the same time deleted the installed java on my system. Noticed that update 2 is the latest availiable on Sun's homepage. It still doesn't work...
